original: LINDHOLM, Erik Vilhelm, Ingenjör, Stockholm, f Eskilstuna 6/9 87 av syssloman E A L o Hilda Lund, gm Signhild Boström. Tekn sk. Prakt v mek verkstäder. Anst v ASEA:s ritkont i Västerås 07, AB Enkps Verkstäders ritkont o verkst 08—12, avd.chef f maskin- o verktygsavd h AB Rylander & Asplund i Sthlm 12—21, vkst dir i AB Servus i Sthlm sed. 21. Rest i Europa o USA.
translated: LINDHOLM, Erik Vilhelm, Engineer, Stockholm, born in Eskilstuna on September 6, 1887, to civil servant E.A.L. and Hilda Lund, married to Signhild Boström. Technical school. Practical experience in mechanical workshops. Employed at ASEA's drafting office in Västerås in 1907, AB Enkps Workshop's drafting office and workshop from 1908 to 1912, department manager for the machine and tool department at AB Rylander & Asplund in Stockholm from 1912 to 1921, director of development at AB Servus in Stockholm since 1921. Traveled in Europe and USA.

structured.name: Erik Vilhelm Lindholm
structured.description: Erik Vilhelm Lindholm was a Swedish engineer from Stockholm. He was born in Eskilstuna on September 6, 1887, to civil servant E.A.L. and Hilda Lund. Erik was married to Signhild Boström. He attended technical school and gained practical experience in mechanical workshops. Erik started his career as a draftsman at ASEA's drafting office in Västerås in 1907. He then worked at AB Enkps Workshop's drafting office and workshop from 1908 to 1912. From 1912 to 1921, Erik held the position of Department Manager for the Machine and Tool Department at AB Rylander & Asplund in Stockholm. Since 1921, he served as the Director of Development at AB Servus in Stockholm. Throughout his career, he traveled extensively in Europe and the USA.

career.workplace: AB Enkps Workshop's drafting office and workshop
